caption: 11/22/20: Only open on weekend mornings from 7a-10a
American food and the feeling at this spot is excellent. Entered near nine, it wasn't busy. The service was very helpful and observant. Bring your hunger - portions are filling.
american food and the scene here is great. i love snacking here. really nothing but enjoyable experiences here, i'll be back.
Great spot for American food. Everyone at our table was enjoying everything. The service was very sociable and kind. The bill was good for how much you get.
american food and the scene at this location is excellent. very tasty. i've had nothing but enjoyable experiences here and plan to keep visiting. the prices are fair for the quality of food.
Excellent scene for quality american food. I like it here, great food & service. There was quick, helpful, and friendly service. The place has a nice atmosphere.
First time eating here, the food, drinks, and music was on point. My husband and I really enjoyed ourselves. I think Everytime we come to Atlanta we will come here.
Delish and nutrish place to wait out a Tabernacle concert!

I really had fun at this dining establishment, the food is incredible, plus the shower rooms were not smelly. It was a little cold indoors, definatly was not totally cool. The service is awesome as well. I will certainly take into consideration going back once more if I have the chance. Me as well as my good friend purchased the sandwiches as well as we were not let down. My one idea is to maintain the cold exterior. Till next time!

Great food and amazing staff, we where here around 9 which they will close at that time of the place is empty but the kitchen still open until 10 pm for the guest in the hotel. Ranesh was a friendly and professional bartender, the food it’s just delicious and fresh made I personally recommend the stake and chimichurri.
Rude people horrible food. Never coming back.
Good people at this place forgot my phone and one of the staff held on to it until we had came back to the Hotel. Stand up folks and good food also.

Ate here this evening and received HORRIBLE service. THE WORST EVER. We came in at 9:30 pm, 30 minutes before they closed and all the lights were turned off and the waitress only offered us drinks. It was clear that she didn't want to serve us real food since she was almost done with her shift. After respectfully asking if the kitchen was still open (it obviously was open until 10) she reluctantly handed us menus and barely spoke a word to us or asked for our orders. We literally had to order from across the restaurant because she wouldn't leave the bar area to come and take our order. When our food came out, she didn't ask if we needed anything or how our food was tasting, she just sat behind the counter. As we ate our average tasting food, she turned off more lights and locked the door to the restaurant, even though it was only 9:52 pm. She asked if we would be charging our food to our room (from behind the counter of course) and we said yes. Since she hadn't said a word to us, we assumed she had taken care of our bill so we got up to leave. As we were leaving, she looked at us and said across the restaurant "EXCUSE ME!?" Puzzled, we walked back over to the bar to see what she wanted, as she handed us our bill. We paid (and left no tip of course) and we were out the door at 9:58 pm. A)Don't lie. If you are open until 10 pm, don't act like your kitchen closes at 9:30. People aren't stupid. B) Learn common sense. Even if you don't want to serve the customer, you'd do well to be kind and serve them warmly so you can make an extra $5 because you're going to be sitting around for another 30 minutes anyways. C) Learn manners. Be polite and walk over to your customer to let them order and to present them their check. If you hate your job, quit. Don't take it out on the innocent customer.
